page.title: 17GRAND UNION CANAL
page.content: The canal that passes through Cowley is the Grand Union Canal which runs from London to Birmingham.The Grand Union Canal was built to transport cargoes such as cotton,wool,coal,wood, building materials,flour,meat and vegetables.The barges were originally pulled by horses walking along the towpath but the horses were replaced by engines.Most of the long boats tied up along the canal now are used as homes or pleasure craft.Cowley lock was built in 1893 and two of the original gates are still used now.It is lock no.89.Locks are needed where the land slopes to allow the boats to travel up or down hill in short stages.At Cowley lock there is a public house_The Shovel,the lock keeper's house and a toll house.
